H0.text: Gravity between the stars causes binary stars to remain together while they orbit around the center of mass of the two stars.

H1.text: Energy released from the stars causes the binary stars, which orbit around their common center of mass, to remain together.

H2.text: Nuclear reactions in the stars cause the binary stars to remain together as they orbit the center of mass of the two stars.

H3.text: Magnetic attraction between the stars is what keeps binary stars together as they orbit around their shared center of mass.

A4.text: A binary star or binary star system is a system of two stars that are gravitationally bound to and in orbit around each other.
